intro: Sida harleyi, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its fibrous stems and leaves are adapted to withstand drought conditions. Sida harleyi is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants with similar morphological traits.
